Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is partly spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of at least one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394829) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394829)
